messages.content: What is the purpose of the DragNUWA Image Canvas in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes?
The DragNUWA Image Canvas is used for DragNUWA nodes, which is from the https://github.com/chaojie/ComfyUI-DragNUWA repository and is the main repo for DragNUWA.
How do Flow Nodes in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes work?

Flow Nodes in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes are designed to run only a part of the entire workflow. By adding the FlowBuilder node right before the output node (PreviewImage, SaveImage, VideoCombine, etc.), it will automatically parse only the nodes for generating that output.
What is the purpose of Getter & Setter Nodes in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes?
Getter & Setter Nodes in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes ensure execution order by connecting them when starting the prompt.
What features does the Ultimate Video Loader in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes offer?

The Ultimate Video Loader allows loading video from several sources (filepath, YouTube, etc.). It offers three source types (file path, file upload, and YouTube) and provides common args such as start_sec, end_sec, max_fps, force_size, and frame_load_cap.
How does the YouTube Video Loader in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes work?
The YouTube Video Loader enables loading and extracting video from YouTube. It offers common args such as start_sec, end_sec, max_fps, and frame_load_cap, as well as an optional output_dir.
What is the purpose of the Image Merger in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes?
The Image Merger in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes is used to merge two images or videos side by side and is useful for comparing the results of img2img or vid2vid.
What information does the System Current Status Viewer in Komojini-ComfyUI-Nodes display?
The System Current Status Viewer displays information about the GPU memory, GPU usage percentage, GPU temperature, CPU usage, and RAM usage every 1 second.
